threats.name: Unauthorized Remote Access
threats.description: Attackers gain unauthorized remote access to industrial control systems through weak authentication or exposed interfaces.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong multi-factor authentication, VPN access controls, and network segmentation for industrial systems.

threats.name: Malware Injection via USB
threats.description: Malicious software introduced through USB devices or removable media targeting industrial systems.
threats.mitigation: Disable USB ports on critical systems, implement application whitelisting, and use endpoint detection solutions.

threats.name: Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
threats.description: Interception and manipulation of communication between industrial devices and control systems.
threats.mitigation: Use encrypted communication protocols, implement certificate-based authentication, and monitor network traffic.

threats.name: Firmware Tampering
threats.description: Unauthorized modification of device firmware to alter functionality or create backdoors.
threats.mitigation: Implement secure boot processes, firmware integrity checking, and maintain updated firmware versions.

threats.name: DoS on Critical Systems
threats.description: Denial of service attacks targeting critical automation infrastructure causing operational disruption.
threats.mitigation: Implement redundant systems, rate limiting, and network monitoring with automated failover mechanisms.

threats.name: Insecure Default Configurations
threats.description: Systems deployed with default passwords and insecure configurations.
threats.mitigation: Change all default credentials, implement security hardening guides, and conduct regular security audits.

threats.name: Payment Card Data Theft
threats.description: Attackers steal credit card information during payment processing or from stored databases.
threats.mitigation: Implement PCI DSS compliance, use tokenization, encrypt card data, and never store sensitive payment information.

threats.name: SQL Injection Attacks
threats.description: Malicious SQL queries injected through input fields to access or manipulate database information.
threats.mitigation: Use parameterized queries, input validation, and implement web application firewalls (WAF).

threats.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
threats.description: Malicious scripts injected into web pages to steal user sessions or redirect to malicious sites.
threats.mitigation: Implement content security policy (CSP), input sanitization, and output encoding for all user inputs.

threats.name: Account Takeover
threats.description: Unauthorized access to customer accounts through credential stuffing or weak authentication.
threats.mitigation: Implement multi-factor authentication, account lockout policies, and monitor for suspicious login patterns.

threats.name: Inventory Manipulation
threats.description: Attackers manipulate product prices, quantities, or availability to exploit the system.
threats.mitigation: Implement proper authorization controls, audit trails, and real-time inventory monitoring systems.

threats.name: Session Hijacking
threats.description: Attackers steal session tokens to impersonate legitimate users and make unauthorized purchases.
threats.mitigation: Use secure session management, HTTPS encryption, and implement session timeout policies.

threats.name: Misconfigured Storage Buckets
threats.description: Cloud storage containers left open to public access exposing sensitive data.
threats.mitigation: Implement proper access controls, regular configuration audits, and use cloud security posture management tools.

threats.name: Insecure APIs
threats.description: Poorly secured APIs allowing unauthorized access to cloud services and data.
threats.mitigation: Implement API authentication, rate limiting, input validation, and regular security testing of APIs.

threats.name: Container Escape
threats.description: Attackers break out of containerized environments to access the host system.
threats.mitigation: Use minimal base images, implement runtime security monitoring, and follow container security best practices.

threats.name: IAM Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Attackers exploit identity and access management misconfigurations to gain elevated privileges.
threats.mitigation: Implement principle of least privilege, regular IAM audits, and use just-in-time access controls.

threats.name: Data Exfiltration
threats.description: Unauthorized transfer of sensitive data from cloud environments to external locations.
threats.mitigation: Implement data loss prevention (DLP), network monitoring, and encrypt data at rest and in transit.

threats.name: Supply Chain Attacks
threats.description: Compromise through third-party dependencies, container images, or cloud service providers.
threats.mitigation: Implement dependency scanning, use trusted registries, and maintain software bill of materials (SBOM).

threats.name: PHI Data Breach
threats.description: Unauthorized access or disclosure of protected health information violating HIPAA regulations.
threats.mitigation: Implement encryption, access controls, audit logging, and HIPAA compliance training for all staff.

threats.name: Ransomware Attacks
threats.description: Malware that encrypts medical systems and data, demanding payment for restoration.
threats.mitigation: Implement regular backups, network segmentation, endpoint protection, and incident response plans.

threats.name: Medical Device Hijacking
threats.description: Attackers compromise connected medical devices to alter functionality or steal data.
threats.mitigation: Implement device authentication, network isolation, and regular security updates for medical devices.

threats.name: Insider Threats
threats.description: Healthcare employees misusing access privileges to steal or alter patient information.
threats.mitigation: Implement role-based access controls, user activity monitoring, and regular access reviews.

threats.name: EHR System Vulnerabilities
threats.description: Security flaws in Electronic Health Record systems allowing unauthorized access.
threats.mitigation: Regular security patching, vulnerability assessments, and implement defense-in-depth strategies.

threats.name: Social Engineering
threats.description: Attackers manipulate healthcare staff to gain unauthorized access to systems or information.
threats.mitigation: Implement security awareness training, verification procedures, and incident reporting mechanisms.

threats.name: Message Interception
threats.description: Attackers intercept and read private messages during transmission or storage.
threats.mitigation: Implement end-to-end encryption, secure key exchange protocols, and forward secrecy mechanisms.

threats.name: Account Impersonation
threats.description: Attackers create fake accounts or compromise existing ones to impersonate users.
threats.mitigation: Implement identity verification, multi-factor authentication, and user reporting mechanisms.

threats.name: Malware Distribution
threats.description: Malicious files or links spread through messaging platforms to infect user devices.
threats.mitigation: Implement file scanning, link analysis, and user education about suspicious content.

threats.name: Spam and Phishing
threats.description: Unwanted messages containing fraudulent content designed to steal credentials or money.
threats.mitigation: Implement spam filtering, content analysis, and user reporting tools for suspicious messages.

threats.name: Data Retention Violations
threats.description: Improper storage or retention of messages violating privacy regulations.
threats.mitigation: Implement data retention policies, automatic deletion, and compliance with privacy regulations.

threats.name: Server-Side Attacks
threats.description: Attackers compromise messaging servers to access all user communications.
threats.mitigation: Implement server hardening, intrusion detection systems, and distributed architecture for resilience.

threats.name: Weak Authentication
threats.description: Systems using weak passwords, default credentials, or inadequate authentication mechanisms.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong password policies, multi-factor authentication, and regular credential audits.

threats.name: Unpatched Vulnerabilities
threats.description: Known security vulnerabilities in software components that remain unpatched.
threats.mitigation: Implement regular patching schedules, vulnerability scanning, and maintain software inventory.

threats.name: Data Encryption Failures
threats.description: Sensitive data stored or transmitted without proper encryption protection.
threats.mitigation: Implement encryption for data at rest and in transit, use strong encryption algorithms and key management.

threats.name: Insufficient Logging
threats.description: Inadequate logging and monitoring making it difficult to detect security incidents.
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging, security monitoring, and incident detection systems.

threats.name: Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Attackers gain higher-level permissions than intended through system vulnerabilities.
threats.mitigation: Implement principle of least privilege, regular access reviews, and privilege monitoring systems.

threats.name: Input Validation Failures
threats.description: Applications failing to properly validate user input leading to various attack vectors.
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive input validation, sanitization, and output encoding practices.
